alert.note: Alert for Cuming; Thurston; Wayne (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Omaha (Eastern Nebraska and Southeastern Iowa - Omaha Valley)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued August 18 at 5:33PM CDT until August 18 at 6:00PM CDT by NWS Omaha
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 600 PM CDT FOR SOUTHEASTERN WAYNE...NORTHEASTERN CUMING AND SOUTHWESTERN THURSTON COUNTIES... At 533 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 8 miles west of Pender, or 10 miles southeast of Wayne, moving southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Wayne, Wakefield, Pender, Beemer, Thurston, The Highway 9 And 51 Junction, Omaha Reservation and Winnebago Reservation. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
